newsitem.title: USA: Insignia says court denies restraining order.
newsitem.headline: Insignia says court denies restraining order.

text.p: Insignia Commerical Group Inc said on Thursday that the Arizona superior court had denied a request by Koll Real Estate Services Inc for a temporary restraining order against the company.

Insignia said Koll sought the order to prohibit Insignia employees and brokers from servicing clients as part of a lawsuit against the company and some of its employees who had left Koll to join Insignia.
"The court's ruling frees the affected Insignia personnel to provide services to their clients without interruption," Insignia said in a statement.

Henry Horowitz, chief operating officer of Insignia, said the decision "underscores that Insignia and its employees acted appropriately in connection with the former Koll associates joining our office in Arizona."
